I'm not sure yet why it is trying to get all the values for the introspect object

((this is without the `@JsonIgnore` commit, testing with latest commit now))

EDIT: fixed in the fix for #2949

@fjy there are no nulls in the data.

[spec.zip](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/files/257849/spec.zip)

I'm also attaching segments metadata:
[metadata.zip](https://github.com/druid-io/druid/files/257872/metadata.zip)

Please advice what other information would be helpful.
@spektom can you profile the indexing job?
@fjy I will try, and report back.
closing this PR

Hey @b-slim, I've noticed of another problem, major one, when graphite becomes unreachable for some time (i just stopped it for a few minutes) then even though it becomes reachable the GraphiteEmitter cannot recover from that and it indefinitely throws exceptions every minute : 

```
2016-05-10T17:42:55,419 ERROR [GraphiteEmitter-0] io.druid.emitter.graphite.GraphiteEmitter - Broken pipe
java.net.SocketException: Broken pipe
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method) ~[?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(SocketOutputStream.java:109) ~[?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:141) ~[?:1.8.0_92]
        at com.codahale.metrics.graphite.PickledGraphite.writeMetrics(PickledGraphite.java:262) ~[metrics-graphite-3.1.2.jar:3.1.2]
        at com.codahale.metrics.graphite.PickledGraphite.flush(PickledGraphite.java:221) ~[metrics-graphite-3.1.2.jar:3.1.2]
        at io.druid.emitter.graphite.GraphiteEmitter$ConsumerRunnable.run(GraphiteEmitter.java:172) [graphite-emitter-0.9.0.jar:0.9.0]
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511) [?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308) [?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180) [?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294) [?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) [?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) [?:1.8.0_92]
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) [?:1.8.0_92]
```

The `PickledGraphite#socker` breaks and it is trying to use it all over again. The connection should be closed and new one created I guess.

its due to skipLoadSpec being set to true in our config. 
the NPE seems to be caused while moving the segment from one server to another. 

Note - It only shows up when we explicitly set  druid.announcer.skipLoadSpec=true in the config.

I think in general this proposal makes sense but the loadingThrottleLimit should be unlimited by default to keep with the current impl of things.

üëç 

See https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2913 as @javasoze's & @gianm's start into this work

:+1: for the code change
but wondering if it helps to have more threads than cores as compute cost appears to be cpu bound really?
@himanshug the current code caps at cores - 1, which is a problem for us when we have 2 cores
we currently spend most of our time doing those cost calculations, so being able to use all cores is beneficial
ok so you really want to set num to be equal to cores not more than that really, that makes sense.

Overall I think the approach is in a good direction. (thinking outloud below)

I'm a bit cautious about the `as(Class<T> clazz)` usage in Segment. Somewhere there needs to be a wiring up from the data in storage to the proper objects for extracting that data. `DataSegment` seems to be the current and proposed descriptor for what data exists. And `QueryableIndex` and `StorageAdapter` for expressing the data.

`QueryableIndex` focuses on making Columns, and `StorageAdapter` focuses on making row cursors.

If I'm reading this correctly, the `as` method effectively finds a factory for the class requested, and calls the factory to create the data expression object (QueryableIndex or StorageAdapter).

The `getSegment` call effectively allows `ServerManager` and others to do some preliminary work on segments by wiring up the mmap stuff, and possibly doing some early validation if needed.

What I'm cautious about is that having `as(Class<T> clazz)` does not free up expressions of data in the way that it looks. This change would effectively make the storage mechanism pluggable (as per the issue title) but doesn't allow for a different range of data expressions compared to what exists now. Specifically, if a target for the `as(Class<T> clazz)` does not appear in the same classloader as io.druid.cli.Main or in the same classloader as the extension with the Segment storage impl, then it cannot be used.

As such, I suggest leaving the two

``` java
  QueryableIndex asQueryableIndex();
  StorageAdapter asStorageAdapter();
```

for now, until use cases for more dynamic data expression can be more fleshed out.
reopening, @acslk saw this on master recently.

Travis failed this test on Java 8, but not Java 7. The failure cannot be reproduced on local machine or another travis test.
The failed assertion is "Assert.assertEquals(1L, dataSourceMap.get(dataSource).get());" which is the same as the one reported in this issue.

https://travis-ci.org/druid-io/druid/jobs/129883914

0.9.1 adds ability to stream back mysql query results per https://github.com/druid-io/druid/pull/2859

But Here it looks like it is blocking on publishing the segment, so I'm curious what is holding onto the db lock preventing this.

You are right this is during the segment publishing.

Its the db connection actually. its trying to communicate on a connection that gcloud doesnt want to anymore.
we ran into this problem a ton when trying to use gcloud's mysql instance ourselves.
The solution was to have much shorter timeouts for everything.
I am fairly sure tweaking dbcp's timeout settings will fix this.
@drcrallen not really as it depends on when coordinator wakes up and update the replication status

That looks like the validation query failing (we use "SELECT 1" by default, maybe the driver decided to parameterize that). I'm not sure why the duration is reported as so high though, did it really take that long or is that possibly some measurement error?

At any rate, I'm not sure what the default validation timeout is, but we could lower it by calling `dataSource.setValidationQueryTimeout` in `SQLMetadataConnector.getDatasource`

it really is taking this long. since we switched to gcloud sql for
metadata, persisting a segment takes almost 20-30 mins post the time period
window.

Hi,
is there any chance to have this module as 0.9 extension (If not already there and I didn't discovered) ?

Thanks
Maurizio

@cheddar I'm proposing to _not_ add a `<T> T as(Class<T> clazz);` method as part of the scope of this PR.

**IF** the `as` method had a java doc contract that nothing other than `QueryableIndex` and/or `StorageAdapter` can be supported at this time, then I'm ok with the proposal. But if you are intending for `as` to be extendable beyond the two classes mentioned, then I think we need to rack out some ideas on how to properly make the data expression side of things more pluggable in the world where the data storage is ALSO pluggable.
Does this one fixed by #2744 ?  https://github.com/druid-io/druid/issues/2744

Ok, if the storage class, data expression class, and query class are all in the same extension then that should be fine, but it would be good if the resulting javadoc for the `as` method clarified this restriction.
Correction: In the same extension OR are used by default druid queries via default druid classes
Overall üëç left one design question.
@valenpo If you have a value in your data of the form "key":["val1","val2"], druid will automatically pick it up as a multi val dimension
Please use https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/druid-user for usage questions.
@navis there are still some outstanding comments with regards to the variance aggregator

@estliberitas can you please update this PR such that the code is contained in an extension-contrib module similar to other community contributed extensions?

Apologies for the delay in reviewing this, we are extremely backed up in reviewing PRs.
